sen.j: 石川 貞道（いしかわ さだみち、生没年不詳）は、安土桃山時代の大名。
sen.e: Sadamichi ISHIKAWA (date of birth and death unknown) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Sadamichi ISHIKAWA (date of birth and death unknown) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Sadamichi ISHIKAWA (date of birth and death unknown) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Azuchi-Momoyama period.
His common name was Koshichiro.
His common name was Koshichiro.
His common name was Koshichiro.
He was a Bingo no kami (the provincial governor of Bingo.)
He was Bingo no kami (the provincial governor of Bingo.)
sen.cmt: ・備後守に不定冠詞は必要ないと思い、削除しました。
sen.e: He was Bingo no kami (the provincial governor of Bingo.)
His imina (posthumous name) was Iekiyo.
His imina (posthumous name) was Iekiyo.
His imina (posthumous name) was Iekiyo.

sen.j: 天正年間に豊臣秀吉に仕え、山城国検地奉行を務め、慶長4 - 5年頃に山城国内および丹波国天田郡において1万2000石を領した。
sen.e: Sadamichi ISHIKAWA served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in Tensho era as the Kenchi survey magistrate of Yamashiro Province, and occupied 12000 koku (crop yields) in Yamashiro Province and Amata county, Tanba Province around 1599 to 1600.

Sadamichi ISHIKAWA served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in Tensho era as the Kenchi survey magistrate of Yamashiro Province, and occupied 12000 koku (crop yields) in Yamashiro Province and Amata county, Tanba Province around 1599 to 1600.

Sadamichi ISHIKAWA served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in Tensho era as the Kenchi survey magistrate of Yamashiro Province, and occupied 12000 koku (crop yields) in Yamashiro Province and Amata county, Tanba Province around 1599 to 1600.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いでは、西軍に組し、7月に大坂口を守備、その後小野木重勝の指揮下に丹波国田辺城の戦いに従軍した。
sen.e: In the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad, defended Osaka guchi in July, and then took a part in a campaign in the battle of Tanabe-jo Castle in Tango Province under the command of Shigekatsu ONOGI.

In the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad, defended Osaka guchi in July, and then took a part in a campaign in the battle of Tanabe-jo Castle in Tanba Province under the command of Shigekatsu ONOGI.
sen.cmt: ・「丹波国」の読み方が訳文で異なっていたので修正しました。
sen.e: In the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad, defended Osaka guchi in July, and then took a part in a campaign in the battle of Tanabe-jo Castle in Tanba Province under the command of Shigekatsu ONOGI.

sen.j: 西軍の敗北により改易となり、翌年9月に盛岡藩主南部利直に預けられた。
sen.e: Due to the West squad' defeat, he forfeited his position and properties (Kaieki), then in September in the following year, he was placed under the supervision of Toshinao NANBU, the Lord of Morioka Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the West squad' defeat, he forfeited his position and properties (Kaieki), then in September in the following year, he was placed under the supervision of Toshinao NANBU, the Lord of Morioka Domain.

Due to the West squad' defeat, he forfeited his position and properties (Kaieki), then in September in the following year, he was placed under the supervision of Toshinao NANBU, the Lord of Morioka Domain.

sen.j: 子孫は同藩士として存続した。
sen.e: Sadamichi's descendants continued as feudal retainers of the Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sadamichi's descendants continued as feudal retainers of the Domain.
Sadamichi's descendants continued as feudal retainers of the Domain.
